node.title: Search for people buried in Canadian landslides begins
node.alt: A volunteer carries a young girl to high ground after using a boat to rescue a woman and children.
node.description: Search teams using dogs are looking for people whose cars may have been buried in landslides across British Columbia.
node.content:
["Search teams using dogs are looking for people whose cars may have been buried in landslides across British Columbia in Canada.", "Storms that\u00a0started on Sunday\u00a0wrecked roads in the Pacific province, forced an oil pipeline to close and limited land access to Vancouver, the city with Canada's largest port.", "Railway lines operated by Canadian Pacific Rail (CP) and Canadian National Railway were both out of service at the towns of Hope and Chilliwack in the lower mainland Fraser Valley region to the east of Vancouver, CP said in a notice to customers.", "Some areas received 200 millimetres of rain on Sunday, the amount that usually falls in a month.", "Rescuers equipped with diggers and dogs are now starting the job of dismantling large mounds of debris that have choked highways.", "", "
A volunteer rescues a woman and children who were stranded by floodwaters.(AP: Canadian Press)
", "\"If a bit of machinery contacts a vehicle or the dogs indicate a person, that's when we stop and \u2026\u00a0dig by hand until we find what they were indicating, to confirm whether it's a live victim or if it's a recovery,\" Captain John Gormick of Vancouver's heavy urban search and rescue team told the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC).", "
Towns evacuated, port takes financial hit
", "The towns of Chilliwack and Abbotsford ordered partial evacuations on Tuesday.", "Images posted to social media showed the land underneath one section of rail track had been washed away.", "", "
Images posted to social media show the extent of the damage.(Reuters:\u00a0British Columbia Transportation)
", "The port Vancouver moves $599\u00a0million\u00a0worth of cargo each day, ranging from vehicles to essential commodities.", "Malcolm Cairns, a rail consultant who used to work for CP, said the railways might be able to reroute some shipments using other lines going north and south from Vancouver, but any workarounds would be costly and slower than usual.", "\"It will harm the flow-through of goods for however long this lasts.\"", "", "
The mudslides have caused extensive damage to Canada's road and rail network.(Reuters:\u00a0B.C. Ministry of Transportation)
", "
Some residents still trapped in homes
", "Authorities in Merritt, some 200 kilometres\u00a0north-east of Vancouver, ordered all 8,000 citizens to leave on Monday as river waters rose quickly.", "But some were trapped in their homes, city spokesman Greg Lowis told the CBC.", "", "
Cows stand in floodwaters\u00a0in Abbotsford.(Reuters:\u00a0Jennifer Gauthier)
", "The landslides and floods come less than six months after wildfires that gutted an entire town\u00a0as temperatures in the province soared during record-breaking heat.", "Helicopters carried out multiple missions on Monday to rescue hundreds of people trapped in their vehicles when mudslides cut off a highway near the mountain town of Agassiz, about 120 kilometres east of Vancouver.", "Reuters"]
